src.optimization package¶

src.optimization.ensemble_utils module¶

src.optimization.ensemble_utils.clean_hyperparameters(hyperparameters)[source]¶

Cleans the hyperparameters dictionary by removing specific prefixes from keys and converting certain float values to integers.

This function processes a dictionary of hyperparameters by: - Removing the ‘params_’ prefix from each key. - Converting float values to integers if the float value is actually an integer.

Parameters:

hyperparameters (dict) – A dictionary where keys are hyperparameter names (potentially with ‘params_’ prefix) and values are hyperparameter values.

Returns:

A cleaned dictionary with updated keys and values.

Return type:

dict

src.optimization.ensemble_utils.create_nn_model(params, input_shape)[source]¶
src.optimization.ensemble_utils.drop_unnessesary_columns(df)[source]¶

Drops columns from the DataFrame that do not contain the substring ‘params’ in their names.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame from which columns will be dropped.

Returns:

A DataFrame with only the columns that contain ‘params’ in their names.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

src.optimization.ensemble_utils.get_predictions(models, X)[source]¶

Generate predictions from a list of models.

Parameters:

  • models (list) – A list of trained models that have a predict method.

  • X (array-like) – The input data to be used for generating predictions.

Returns:

An array of predictions from each model, where each row corresponds to the predictions of a single model.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

src.optimization.ensemble_utils.soft_voting(models, X)[source]¶

Perform soft voting ensemble method on the given models and input data.

Soft voting averages the predicted probabilities of each model to make a final prediction.

Parameters:

  • models (list) – A list of trained models that support the predict_proba method.

  • X (array-like) – The input data to predict on.

Returns:

The averaged predicted probabilities from all models.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

src.optimization.ensemble_utils.weighted_voting(predictions, weights)[source]¶

Combine predictions from multiple models using weighted voting.

Parameters:

  • predictions (dict) – A dictionary where keys are model names and values are arrays of predictions from each model.

  • weights (dict) – A dictionary where keys are model names and values are the corresponding weights for each model.

Returns:

An array of combined predictions, weighted and normalized by the sum of weights.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class src.optimization.model_optimizer.ModelOptimizer(train_set, test_set)[source]¶

Bases: object

cat_objective(trial)[source]¶

Objective function for optimizing CatBoostClassifier using Optuna.

Parameters:

trial (optuna.trial.Trial) – A trial object for suggesting hyperparameters.

Returns:

Weighted recall score for the trial.

float

optimize_catboost(n_trials=100)[source]¶

Optimizes CatBoostClassifier using Optuna.

Parameters:

n_trials (int, optional) – Number of trials for optimization (default is 100).

Returns:

DataFrame containing the results of the optimization trials.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

weighted_recall(y_true, y_pred)[source]¶

Calculates a weighted recall score.

Parameters:

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – True labels.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray) – Predicted labels.

Returns:

Weighted recall score.

Return type:

float
